title: The mystery of Berthold's Quadra 57 BQ...
content:
A bit of a mystery, but perhaps someone here knows right off what the story is.

I saw an example of Berthold's Quadra 57 BQ ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/quadra-57-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143133/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/quadra-57-bq/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/quadra-57-bq/")) that led me to believe it was the absolute perfect solution for a project I'm working on.

Problem is, I can't find it. Anywhere. It's listed on myFonts, but as no longer available. Poking around Berthold's site, it's not there at all. All references to it that I can find on the web point to myFonts.

It's not a new font (1974), so I can't imagine any copyright issues that would explain it's disappearance.

Anyone know the story?
author: Suijin

comments.content:
Just a wild guess on my part, maybe it hasn't been converted to otf yet?:  
 [http://berthold.forest.net/bq\_library/90121.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143133/http:/berthold.forest.net/bq_library/90121.html "http://berthold.forest.net/bq\_library/90121.html")
It is available at the link Special-K provided (see their Shopping Cart button), but only in Type 1 format; $39.00 per font, 1-5 users.
Mystery solved, as that's a pretty logical conclusion. Thanks!

Spade looks almost identical, from what I can tell if you need otf:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/spade/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143133/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/spade/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/spade/")
